claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling in the tumor microenvironment.

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: The interferon response was measured as a normalized score; absolute cytokine concentrations were not reported.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination increases the diversity and quantity of tumor-associated peptides presented on MHC-I molecules.

evidence.quote: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination

claims.caveat: The immunopeptidomics analysis was performed on bulk tumor tissue; single-cell resolution of peptide presentation was not achieved.

claims.claim: PD-L1 expression increases following mRNA vaccination, making tumors more susceptible to PD-L1 blockade therapy.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy

claims.caveat: PD-L1 expression was measured by fold-change; absolute expression levels and spatial distribution were not detailed.

claims.claim: Patients who received SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination showed improved survival outcomes when undergoing immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Human retrospective metastatic cohort: 130 patients total | Human vaccinated subgroup: 43 patients | Human unvaccinated subgroup: 87 patients

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients.

claims.claim: The combination of intratumoral mRNA vaccination and anti-PD-L1 therapy produces superior tumor control compared to either treatment alone.

evidence.quote: Mouse efficacy cohort (combination therapy): 78 tumor-bearing mice pooled across repeat experiments.
Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.

claims.caveat: Tumor control was assessed in murine models; human translation requires prospective randomized trials.
